author: Leikp56
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My time in the Nightingale
body:
I started in the Mater – But I don’t remember that. I was in a coma for 3 – 4 weeks.  
I was moved to the City Hospital. When I woke up, just lying in bed with tubes all over me I can remember being thirsty and the nurse moistening my lips with a sponge.  
My treatment was second to none. Every nurse, doctor and physio were so good. There wasn’t enough staff, but the staff that were there were absolutely brilliant. They talk to you as a person – and that makes all the difference.  
I came to Ward 2 in the Whiteabbey Nightingale. I had six days of good, solid rehabilitation. Once I got in, everyone was round making sure I was comfortable. Olwyn and Gill got me on my feet in five days without aids.  
The staff always help me with my needs. Ruby is so friendly. Karen is another angel… and Tracy, Hayley and Marion. In fact all the staff are the same.  
The ward is comfortable. It is spotless. The domestics and nurses are always wiping everything down. The food is good. Cups of tea – the nurses always get me one.  
Everything is always done with a smile.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Prompt and very efficient
body: In combination with NHS111 and William Harvey Ophthalmology Dept the Faversham Urgent Treatment Paramedic was able to deal with my queries in a prompt and efficient way. He was available at exactly the time allotted, my condition was reviewed quickly, contact was made with WH Ophthalmology specialist, the necessary treatment/prescription was reviewed and issued.  The whole process was incredibly efficient and reassuring for me.

title: Always helpful
body: Called today for my son who’s not well and spoke to the Practice manager who was very helpful, I then had a telephone call with the ANP who was very good. Would highly recommend this practice they are always very helpful.

title: Thank you for such good care
body: My elderly mother was admitted to Ealing Hospital on 13th November after a fall at home. She received excellent and timely care and was given kind and caring end of life care. I live locally and was able to see her at the end for which I am very grateful. Thank you to all the staff.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Wonderful caring staff
body: I just want to say how amazing the lady on reception was today - I have emailed separately too.  My son was struggling to walk and she got him a wheelchair.  I’d forgotten the paperwork and she advised me on what to do and checked we were ok.  Then as my son hurt his hand at the car afterwards, she helped us again and was so patient and caring - so wonderful to meet someone like this, it made such a difference.  All of the other staff we saw were great too.  Thank you all so much!

title: Cataract surgery
body: My mum had a cataract operation recently.  From the pre op apt to the two operations everything went very smoothly .  Staff and surgeon were excellent

title: Great Professionalism
body: I contacted the surgery recently regarding an issue with my urinary tract infection. Dr went out of her way to speed up the process of next steps for me to promptly receive a prescription. She was incredibly understanding and empathetic, despite her having a tight schedule during the Corona virus pandemic. I felt very comfortable and well looked after,  I will happily recommend this practice.

title: Great people at earls court
body: Excellent call ..we established a solid plan of action. My prescription will be delivered to the local boots

title: getting appointments
body: It continues to be a miserable experience trying to get appointments at this surgery, and this predates Covid. It is extremely difficult to get through at 8am to book an appointment, so most if not all are gone when you finally do get through. (For flu jabs, people seem happy, but maybe it is scheduled or walk in). Also, there is no 'place in queue' system, so you have no idea if they are about to answer, which on average seems to take about 20 minutes. In theory, there is an online booking system with the website saying you can book up to four months in advance. I've been on several times at different periods, but this has never been the case; there are often no GP appointments on it at all - today just had phlebotomy (?) appointments. Again this is compounded by no information on how many appointments are available, if they are added every day, or once a week etc, or when they go live so you can book. This means you have to sit on your computer throughout the day refreshing the screen to see if anything comes up.  So after failing the telephone and online route, you can try a different NHS symptom call back service. This means registering on their website, but today's slots were also taken, but again, no information on how many are available. That system goes live at midnight every day, so I am going to stay up and try that. At the end of the day, the phone and two online systems are routing you to a fixed number of doctors, and there are obviously not enough. But then it is a waste of time finding this out, and obviously aggravates staff and patients as other reviews demonstrate. A couple of things could help this fruitless waiting - one, put a 'place in queue' on the phone system; two, add text (or blocked out calendar) to the online appointments system or on the main website, saying how many online bookings are usually available and when they go live; three, add text (or blocked out calendar)  on the NHS symptom call back service. The advice pre Covid was to actually turn up at the surgery round 7.30am to get an appointment, which is what I have done before, but this is obviously not available, plus it is bit of an indictment. Finally, if you go to the walk-in clinic downstairs in desperation (also done this) it is usually a long wait, but more importantly, if your problem needs a hospital referral, they can't do this, so you have to go back to trying to see your GP. Be warned! All that said, if and when you do get an appointment, the staff are always lovely, but I don't think they fully realise how awful the booking system is, either because they don't go through it, or because patients are so grateful to see them that they don't say anything, or because they dismiss the complaints here as  unbalanced. I do hope it gets sorted as it is miserable. I meanwhile, will try at midnight, and/or at 8am!

title: Ticking all the right boxes
body: The staff This practice have been amazing the receptionists are really polite and helpful nothing is too much trouble. The GPS ring when they say they will I feel very lucky to be a patient here

title: Compassionate service
body: Thanks so much for the kind and compassionate service today! The person taking the call was thoughtful and efficient and is an asset to Wokingham Medical Centre

title: Great service
body: I was referred for urgent investigation of a potentially serious gynaecological symptom. Within just over two weeks of my initial appointment at my GP surgery I was seen at the Women’s Centre in Crawley Hospital. I had a sonic ultrasound examination and a further examination, which showed that everything was completely normal. All the staff were friendly as well as professional, I’d been so worried but their care and attention was first class.

title: Horrible and Rude Receptionist
body:
There is one of the members of their staff who is too rude and horrible. She behaves as if she is the owner of the surgery and has the worst manners ever!!!
She makes you feel so uncomfortable that I have stopped calling in for appointments and suffer in silence when I need to see the gp or call out of hours for help. 
I am in the process of changing the GP surgery as this can't go on anymore.
Would really like to know who manages the practice and why can they not train their staff to be polite and respectful!!!

title: Feedback
body: Whilst the optician I have been referred to is very efficient I found when issues arise they were unqualified to help me causing unnecessary anxiety. I would have preferred to be able to discuss these issues with an eye doctor directly instead of going through a third party who had to fill out reports and then wait for a reply to come back via the third party. This was quite time consuming and stressful.

title: Appalling practice
body: This has to be the worst practice known to man. Reception staff are extremely rude, incredibly unprofessional and thick as soup. The Drs however are fantastic. It's virtually impossible to get an appointment the telephone lines are constantly engaged and when you eventually get through 3 days later, you are met with rudeness and unprofessionalism from the reception staff who make it extremely hard for you to get where you want to be with in the practice. I've been registered here for over 30 years and have never known it to be quiet as abhorrent as it is today, so much so that I have left and gone elsewhere. Bad show HHT, shame on you.

title: Not so good
body: Despite multiple attempts to ring various wards over several short admission periods since Sept 2020, it is very difficult to get calls answered. Communication with family members is generally appalling unless the pt is near death or in ITU.  Very very disappointed at the decline of standards and care.

title: Great experience
body:
This was my 2nd baby at PRU and mt 4th c section. The care I received from start to finish was amazing. I was v worried about being alone and unsupported due to covid restrictions etc as husband was only allowed to come and leave only once. 
Midwives were extremely caring and I didn't feel uncared for. The operation itself was handled really well with lots of care and professionalism. 
Overall a good experience under difficult circumstances.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Experience
body: I went to have my first smear test done and was a little apprehensive after previous experiences however the practitioner was so lovely and chatty and really put me at ease before the procedure. She heated up the speculum so it was less uncomfortable and it was less than 30 seconds in total. I just want to say thank you for making my experience as easy and nice as possible!

author: Agnes20
title: Recent surgery
body:
Felt valued and well looked after by whole Team, anaesthetist and nursing team, doctors.  
So much care, compassion and dedication by these people. Care given was individualised and holistic.  
Forever grateful

readBy.name: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust
Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

author: CHEEKY CHAPPY
title: All the staff were truly fantastic.
body:
Forth valley In Larbert, Mr Deleeuw was very thorough and straight talking and that is what you want with people. After op the dosage on painkillers were wrong but was not staff fault, The painkillers I was taking pre-op were about 3x more as on my prescriptions. Had to be a written request to my GP, therefore it was not on my prescription pink slip repeat slip, staff didn't know this. While staff were wondering why my pain was so severe it was because it wasn't stated I was taking more painkillers pre-op than post op, once we got to bottom of it my pain relief was quickly sorted and made all the difference.  
All and I mean all the staff in FVH, SEU 11a Ward, were truly fantastic, if I ever need my other knee done I hope I go to this ward for after care. Bit of Banter with Michael was good, and without naming anyone, they were all superb, ❤🤍💙 well done.

title: Amazing staff
body: I was recently admitted with a fractured spine. Naturally I was extremely distressed about this. But I wanted to mention every single member of the Kingfisher ward went above and beyond to make me feel welcome and cared for. The nurses are just brilliant and I’ve really appreciated their help and friendliness.

readBy.name: Great Western Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Avoid if you can - under resourced Practice
body: Be prepared to wait 30 minutes plus to then speak to Reception on the phone.  Practice does not use email.   This means we have had to use 111 because it's so hard to speak with a GP.

title: Excellent support
body:
During this past year I’ve had numerous contacts with several Doctors in the practice. They have all responded quickly and provided total support to me. I am really grateful as I had a few issues that were worrying me. 
I would like to thank the very efficient admin/ reception staff and all the doctors who have helped me during the past year in particular . 
Professional , caring, kind and helpful

title: Great care and service
body: My daughter, aged 10 was in for an operation. The team were very caring and supportive and made her feel very relaxed. Everything went very well and my daughter was at ease throughout.

title: No availability, gone down hill fast
body:
Since the withdrawl of contact forms there is a no longer any meaningful way to make contact. 200+ (no exaggeration) phone calls to finally get through.

Phone message says they open at 8am (they dont, its 8:30 on the phone lines)
Constantly engaged phone line and needed an hour of constant dialling then waiting to get through.

title: Pointless visit, unhelpful Doctors
body: Identical experience to previous commenter. I didn't feel like I was being listened to and rushed to leave. Complained about chest pain and other issues then was told that it was all in my head. None of my issues were dealt with and all had been a pointless visit, as always.

title: Great
body: Found the receptionist very friendly and helpful. Delt with me very proptley and with care and compassion. Found it very easy to get the help I needed and  can not belive how friendly they are. Would tell anyone looking for doctors to join this surgery.

title: Results never sent to GP (Andrology department)
body: My husband has a fertility test done on the 6th November, and the results have still not been sent to our GP. Our GP clinic has emailed twice since then and called but there has been no response. We have called several times and left voicemails but have not heard back from you. Please can you contact us to let us know when the results will be sent to our GP as this is an incredibly stressful time for us. The lack of control and the situation we are in is already causing us severe anxiety and stress, and this process has added to our emotional distress. This is the second time this has happened using this service (first time in October), although the first time someone picked up the phone eventually and was able to get the results to our doctor. This time there has been zero response from the clinic to us or our GP.

title: Outstanding staff
body: I recently brought my son aged 8 for a pre clinic COVID swab. The set up outside the hospital was well signposted and the procedure easy to follow. My child, having ASD was apprehensive and quite unwilling to have the swab. We were greeted by an amazing lady who was empathetic and so caring with my son. She instantly recognised his ASD as he was anxiously chewing. She spent time and effort to talk and calm my son before and during the swab. She was a kind and caring member of the NHS and more importantly, a very special person- Thank you

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Worst practice and receptionist
body:
I called to book an appointment for my daughter's yearly vaccination to which I had this rude receptionist telling me that it's not their responsibility to contact me in regards to the yearly vaccination appointment and it's my responsibility!!!
I understand that it is our responsibility but why was I told by the nurse when she had her last vaccines that the surgery will contact you near the time!!! They can not contact you for anything be it blood test results or review for different conditions!! It feels like Covid-19 is a very good excuse for them not no look and care for the people who need the care!!
I really don't understand why this one particular receptionist thinks shes the owner of the surgery as her attitude is so unpleasant and unprofessional. 
She behaves she's a doctor in that practice!!! She can never give you appointments despite calling at 8n00am!!
Why do some people have no professional skills of working in their job roles?!!
She needs to be given some training as she lacks the communication skills desired for her job!!! I need the practice manager to contact me if there is one as the last time I spoke to them to raise a complaint, they never had a practice manager!!
They make you feel helpless and stress you more especially for a parent who is dealing with her own mental health problem and on top of it you get stressed by people with no empathy!!!

title: great staff
body: I am a registered manager of a care home and brought a lady in for a operation on 30/11/2020 the lady has additional needs with her dementia. She was admitted to ward 3A  and we were given a side room. The staff were very pleasant and patient with the lady they talked us through every step of the way. They offered refreshments and even allowed us to walk down to theatre whilst they put her canular in. This really helped our lady that we were there and that the staff were so lovely. I would like my feed back to be passed on to the ward 3a and also to theatre and tell a big thank you from the managers at prospect house.

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

author: MrSongster
title: Occupational health support
body:
During lockdown I hit a bout of anxiety, panic, fear and depression which took me to the very edge. I didn’t think I was going to survive and thoughts of taking my own life were a constant presence.  
My GP helped with meditation and referred me to the Lanarkshire occupational health team.  
My support came from a young man Connor who was a fantastic listener with a lovely manner and caring nature. Connor helped me with coping strategies, listening, talking things through while taking things a day at a time which really worked for me.  
I am extremely grateful and fortunate to have had this support for several weeks and I am now feeling like my old self again.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership
South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

title: Poor customer service
body: Unhelpful members of staff at Wolverhampton location. No concern about patient and the fact that how long we have been waiting for this appointment. Clinician didn’t call as per appointment (called 11 mins late) and when we call back after 15 mins we were told to rebook our appointment again. I would never expect that from any NHS or supporting services. I have worked with NHS for long enough to know their dedication and willingness to help and experience like this will never discredit their hard work and support.

title: Not helpful wanted to just hang up on me
body: I called to change as I am pregnant and I needed a GP nearer by, the receptionist couldnt wait to hang up, felt 0 care and made me feel bad made me not want to change to this surgery

title: Swift and speedy reaction to my "problem"
body: Phoned surgery at 09.45 this morning. Spoke to a lovely receptionist and when I explained my "problem" she said she would get a nurse to phone me back from now to 13.30hrs. Within a minute of my call the nurse phoned me back and prescribed antibiotics. Absolutely wonderful service and both the receptionist and nurse put my mind at rest. WELL DONE

author: Anonymous 76
title: Thank you
body:
I am a long-term opiate client (I wish to remain anonymous) but I just want to say how supportive CGL are to my needs, everything is so well organised and everybody is very good at their job and all take great pride in what they do. From my recovery co-ordinator who I know is always there for me should I ever need anything to the back office staff such as the young chap at Cambridge who looks after all the scripts, I remember once when there was a problem with my script he went out of his way to resolve it with the pharmacy quickly. The management team and everybody else who all strive together to create a caring and supportive service. We are treated like an individual and not a number it is very re-assuring to know that CGL are there for me.  
You should all be so proud every day to be part of a fantastic service.

author: TSimp
title: Delivery experiences
body: I am a Mother two boys delivered by midwives at Scunthorpe Hospital and twice I have felt really satisfied and happy with the amount of care I have received. They make you feel like you have have known them a while and family and they are very kind to you. The day after coming home from hospital, I cried because I missed all the midwives that were part of my care and thought of how lovely and welcoming they made my stay there.

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

author: Willow123
title: No explanation for the long wait
body: I am disgusted by the service and lack of care provided by the Willow Ward. I feel like I need to provide this feedback even though I'm sure it won't make a difference. I was told by a midwife that I needed an Anti D injection as soon as possible due to potential internal bleeding. The Midwife then booked me in for an appointment at 7pm at the Willow Ward at Musgrove Hospital for a blood sample and an Anti D injection. When I arrived at the Willow Ward the waiting room was empty but for some reason they still made me wait 30 minutes before taking a blood sample. All the while there were a few care assistants chatting nearby. I asked the person doing the blood sample if they knew what it was for and was told no and that they had been told to take a sample and that was it. I knew that the sample was to confirm if there had been internal bleeding. After the blood sample I was told to go wait in the empty waiting room again. The staff member doing the blood test then comes up to me later with the label for my blood test asking me to check that my name was spelt correctly, which it wasn't, even though they had my papers. I was then left waiting in the lobby for a further 3 hours, waiting for an Anti D injection. The care assistants were too busy chatting amongst themselves the whole time. I had to repeatedly go up to them to try to find out what was going on and why I was waiting so long. They were not able to provide me with any answers and it seemed like they didn't know anything. They just kept saying that they will ask someone. In total I had been left waiting in the empty lobby by myself for 3. 5 hours. My husband wasn't allowed in even though it was only me there and the waiting room could hold 4 people with social distancing. The care assistants did not even offer me a glass of water or anything. They just ignored me for 3. 5 hours until I finally broke down crying from the whole situation and from pain from sitting in the same seat for so long. At that point they saw me crying and went and got a midwife who gave me the Anti D injection. I asked the Midwife why it took so long and they said that they didn't realise I was waiting for so long. This is hard to believe because I had a booking for 7pm and it was now 10:30pm. I was the only person in the waiting room so everyone saw me sitting there and kept looking at me as they walked past. I asked when I would know the results of the blood test and the midwife said they may have them tomorrow. So there was no explanation why it took 3.5 hours for an Anti D injection.

author: Womb64
title: Poor Care of a vulnerable disabled patient with dementia
body:
My husband is reliant on people for all his care due to his disability & vascular dementia. He was declared medically fit 10 days before he actually came home. They wouldn't let him come home because he wouldn't eat for them so I said he will at home but no they wouldn't let him out. Then they said his sugar levels weren't stable. Well no they wont be because he's in hospital & wont eat properly. When he finally came home they'd put him on different insulin the day before & his blood sugar rose to 29 with ketones of 3.4 so had to phone 111 who sent paramedics who wanted to take him back to RH but he refused. He was so dehydrated he didn't pass urine properly for over 48 hours, he'd lost 2cm from the circumference of his arm. He had dirty dressings on. Dried hard food that had to be cut out of his beard. He couldn't drink as he had no strength to suck on straw I had to use a syringe. His mouth was full of brown gunk & he couldn't communicate as he was so dry & had to blink for yes & no for me.Apparently they'd informed me of his deterioration. I'd love to know when they phoned me as I can prove from phone records that they didn't.  
In my opinion they nearly let my husband die. They said he refused personal care so why didn't they let him come home so I could look after him. A few days after being at home he is communicating well, eating & drinking, already putting weight on & his diabetes is stable again as he's back on his original insulin.  
I'm disgusted that people who are supposed to care, people you trust your vulnerable loved ones with, can stand by & let someone deteriorate like that when all they needed to do in my view was let him come home & be looked after properly because there was nothing medically wrong to stop this happening.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

author: kg-2020
title: Made my recovery much easier
body:
I had the misfortune recently of undergoing a fairly upsetting operation. I am 67 years old and had to travel to Ninewells to be put under the surgery. This was particularly heavy going given that Covid-19 was in full flight.  
I had wounds as a product of the surgery and faced a long recovery in Dundee. With no visitors allowed. An alternative programme of after care was drawn up with the local wound clinic. This made the recovery a much easier exercise.  
Much thanks to the wound team.

author: freshair
title: I felt listened to after my breakdown
body: I went through a bout of depression, anxiety and general mental health breakdown during the lockdown period of Covid-19. As a result of my being sectioned 3 times I was referred to Kelly via Grays Hall who assisted me with mind mapping, career planning, life goals, therapy and eventually helping me find a job.

author: Lken24
title: My son going to theatre
body: As a mum during these difficult times we where made to feel at ease and in safe hands, we cannot fault the care that we received in A&E and the Craig ward when our son required sedation and treatment in theatre. Everyone that came into contact with us went above and beyond during a very stressful time.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Dodger
title: Brilliant job thank you!
body: Went into A& E after having chest pain. Got seen really quickly and wow how efficient blood ecg and all that happening all at once and the humour was great. Couple of hours all sorted and on the way home. Brilliant job guys and girls. And thank you👍

links.id: the humour from the staff kept me relaxed

author: Mora9is5
title: Hip replacement
body: Required new hip got spinal infusion didn’t feel anything listened to the Rolling Stones and Freddie Mercury. Staff excellent and very catering home next day to recuperate.

author: HolLC
title: Home Birth
body:
Our first baby was born at home and I delivered him into our family in the birth pool in the most calm and love-filled environment, with my husband and two wonderful midwives there to support us.  
Moving to the Home Birth team’s care mid-pregnancy (and during the Covid-19 pandemic) filled me with confidence that we would be supported completely to have the birth we wanted.  
Diane, our midwife, brought calmness, kindness and professionalism to every appointment and always listened carefully to us and answered all our questions with no judgement whatsoever, however small the question. We really felt such support by her attentiveness.  
When it came to the birth, I was completely in the zone of breathing through each contraction, so although I did not interact much with Diane and our second midwife, Kylie, I knew they were there the whole time and that I didn’t need to worry. I was confident that they would follow our birth preferences that we had discussed during our antenatal appointments and Diane was brilliant at understanding our desires and following these through at every point. I was very grateful when she reminded me that I wanted to catch our baby, as I would have forgotten in the moment! The little touches such as Diane’s knowledge and use of aromatherapy were so thoughtful and appreciated. During labour, although my eyes were closed in concentration, I knew that either my husband or Diane or Kylie were there beside me to hold my hand, give me water or snacks, help with the gas and air or simply mutter a word of encouragement.  
The birth was so calm and couldn’t have gone better. I really am so grateful to Diane for her attention to detail and kindness throughout our antenatal experience and then during the birth. I didn’t need to worry at any point that our choices would not be supported, which gave me the freedom to focus completely on remaining calm and concentrating on birthing our baby. It was Kylie’s first home birth which was such an honour and she was also so supportive in her role.  
Thank you both so much for supporting and sharing the experience with us. I would highly recommend the Home Birth team! I felt so well cared for by Diane and her attentiveness was very much appreciated.

author: doneman
title: Delay to normal services
body: I am speaking on behalf of my wife who is suffering badly from rectal bleeding and pain since July 2020. The doctors at our surgery have done their utmost to help her by prescribing medication but she is still suffering a lot. I accept the coronavirus must have an effect on normal service but to watch her in so much pain is distressing.

author: Rf2605
title: Maternity care
body: I had a pretty eventful and traumatic labour and birth which involved being rushed from the home from home unit to labour ward to being rushed to theatre due to baby’s heart rate not recovering to being back to continue my labour (after baby recovered) to ending with an unplanned section due to baby not turning at the end of my delivery. All staff I encountered were fantastic, the doctors, surgeons, anaesthetists, nurses and midwives. They all made sure my partner and I knew what was happening at each point of my labour especially during the stressful points where either myself and/or baby were distressed in some way. Special mention to my midwife who was with me from labour ward to delivery in theatre and in recovery the next day (Claire). She was an amazing support and held my hand when my husband couldn’t be with me at times. I wouldn’t have been able to do it all without her. She stayed 2hrs past her shift time just to see me through my c section (my worst fear) and see my baby girl being born. The care I received from start to finish from all staff was second to none especially during covid-19 times.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: McL35
title: Lovely student nurse
body: I was a patient in station 10 a few weeks ago after a recent leg fracture. I just want to comment on how lovely all the staff where and the surgeon who did my operation and all the staff in theatre and recovery. Whilst I was a patient I was a bit anxious at times and I just want to mention how lovely the student nurse Stephanie was. Stephanie took the time when she was on shift to not only talk to me but the other patients, she reassured me when I was anxious and just generally made time for her patients. I looked forward to the shifts she was on as nothing was ever too much trouble, she will make a brilliant nurse with her caring attitude and empathy towards patients.   A lovely ward with lovely staff.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: Anne74
title: Nursing and doctor care
body: I would like to pass on my thanks to medical high care, ICU and ward 2d for the care they showed my father in law during the time he was in hospital and all the updates they took the time to give us when doing a hard job looking after some very sick people in exceptional circumstances

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: Publicbell
title: Cytosponge
body: Was one of the first patients to get the cytosponge in the hospital, Rosie phoned me and asked if I’d like to have it instead of an endoscopy as waiting lists are very big due to Covid 19, she explained the test and organised a Covid test for me to get done first. The procedure was really easy, was glad to meet the same nurse (Rosie) again, as she did my procedure, she was very good, explained it all and it was done in 10 minutes, much better than a horrible scope, well done Crosshouse for training nurses to do this, I will not worry as much about coming in any more, And I got personally phoned by ROSIE with my results within 10 days, Great service.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: Rab67
title: Flu jab
body:
Went to get flu jab at the Time Capsule, Coatbridge. Staff where fantastic.  
But why oh why are the poor staff sitting in the cold? Please supply some proper heating or better facilities.

title: Considerate care and patience
body: My GP has been extremely supportive of me during a difficult personal time despite the pressure the GPs find themselves under he has taken the time to listen and support me. I never feel like I'm a burden and he has shown empathy and insight into my particular circumstances. I wanted to record my gratitude to him and the staff at the practice  all doing a great job.

title: Fantastic practice
body: The doctor was polite, I was informed a week ago and today that there would be students which I appreciated, it wasn’t my usual doctor but he put me at ease right from the outset, and most importantly he treated me like a human being. The students were very polite too and I was more than willing to cooperate with them.

title: Fantastic practise
body:
Fantastic practise with caring staff from the receptionists, nurses right up to the doctors. 
Nothing was too much trouble and the doctor explained all the tests that would be needed and why.

title: outstanding service
body: i must admit i was nervous when going for my cataract operation but i was put at ease by the very friendly staff every thing was explained to me  and i was amazed how every thing went from entering the clinic to leaving everybody was very professional i can`t  praise the  staff enough nothing was to much trouble for them and the outcome absolutely brilliant to have clear vision in my eye. i can`t wait to have my other eye done now  would like to say a very, very big thank you to everybody

title: Local good practice
body: Had to attend to see a member of the medical staff as just been diagnosed with Asthma and a bit worried how to manage it. Was given a really good explanation on what Asthma was and the proper way to use the inhalers. Came away with a clear view of what I need to do. Was also told if I had any worries to  contact the surgery.

title: Great practice
body: Helpful, efficient and understanding  , very  reception staff , I have every confidence with the surgery especially in these difficult conditions

title: Really good service
body:
I was admitted as an urgency a few days ago with a kidney stone. I had excellent, immediate
 treatment from all the doctors and staff on the surgical assessment unit and theatre. They were all lovely and nothing was too much trouble. Thank you so much Stepping Hill especially under such difficult conditions.

title: THE ‘A’ TEAM
body: I received great care on ward 4 south .The whole team there were extremely ,profession ,empathetic ,and cheerful during my 10 day stay .I can’t thank them enough.

title: An Excellent and caring surgery
body: I have visited the surgery on many occasions with my elderly mother who was 90. The surgery team was always caring and efficient and made time to understand and address all medical problems. I am grateful for their help and can strongly recommend Box Surgery.

title: Great practice
body:
Nothing is ever too much for the staff at this GP practice and I can not tell you how happy I am to have moved here. I am yet to have anything but a good experience. The reception team are so friendly, understanding and knowledge, I never feel a trouble to them even though they're so very busy at 8 am. No matter what my question I finally never feel a problem or silly. 
The doctors have been incredible to, with my post natal care and helping me with my concerns over my new born. Its such difficulties times as we can't see each other face to face and the doctors have to rely on my answers buts they really take the time to help me with what ever the problem is and again I never feel a problem to them. 
It means a
lot to me to have such lovely doctors I can talk to and know I am getting the care and courses of action right for my self or my children.

title: Excellent Practice
body: Covid-19 rules are in place. Very little waiting time. Phone appointment on time. The doctors discuss all issues clearly and give specific and precise advice. My medical details were explained in a way I could understand.

title: Great practice always helpful
body:
Couldn’t ask for a more caring professional doctors that are at the limes medical centre
They looked after my wife who was terminally ill with cancer always able to speak to them never a problem total respect for there patients

title: Flu jabs well organised
body:
This year's flu vaccinations were done very efficiently and CoVid secure.

Same again please for the CoVid vaccine once it becomes available.

title: A totally painless process.
body: My first visit here for my annual blood test. I arrived ten minutes early for my booked appointment and was called in immediately.  My veins are not the easiest to get blood from but the technician was quick, efficient and reassuring.  Having the radio on is a great idea.  I have no problems with recommending this service.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Reliable
body: All done very safe and professional , very happy with the way things are being run under difficult circumstances

title: Exceptional
body: Our son, who is Downs,  needed an operation at Torbay Hospital and the Eye Surgery team were caring and supportive.  Cannot praise them enough.  The Consultant, Anaesthetist, nurse and admin. staff were all exceptional.

title: Flu vaccination - fantastic service
body: This was an amazing experience - I was in and out of the surgery having had the vaccination in less than five minutes. It’s always good but in these Covid times it was  very well organised.

title: This review is for the care given to my late…
body:
Over many years provided professional, compassionate care for my Mum. 
Professional care delivered with kindness and compassion over a number of years.

title: Great service
body: Very local to home.  No having to pay extortionate parking.  The staff are very friendly and efficient.

title: Great Practice, well organised
body:
My wife and I have been patients of the surgery for over 30 years and have always been treated with respect and kindness by everyone.
I attended for my flu injection and was very impressed how organised the whole process was.  
I have difficulty in walking and was not rushed and found the whole procedure excellent.  I felt very safe when in the practice and was back in my car in not time at all with no worry.

author: ACAL
title: Child birth
body: Gave birth in the Ulster in May, right in the middle of lockdown. I was induced on a Sunday and our beautiful boy was born on Monday. I felt so anxious going in and throughout my induction. There was some staff on the ward but only maybe 2 or 3. They were lovely and friendly but left me to it and kept my curtain around me shut. Weirdly there wasn't another person in the ward, made it even weirder. The midwife who was there at night wasn't the nicest, and made some remarks that I'll never forget. Waters broke through the night, once there was a staff change (not sure of timings) things honestly couldn't have been better the staff, midwives, doctors and a student were all absolutely fantastic. Made me feel so as ease and comfortable. We were moved to the ward later that day and said a sad goodbye to my husband. Again the staff in the ward downstairs were amazing! They helped me so much, I was finding it hard to stand and was bed bound for a while to recover. And they were brilliant. Anytime I buzzed they were straight in. Very helpful. They were fantastic with our son too. Helped me feed him and bathe him etc. Also the food was lovely too. Haven't much to complain about, just one person but that won't take away from how amazing everyone else is! Can't sing their praises high enough.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent person centred care
body:
I became a patient at Ashfields after moving to the area 18 months ago. I was in a very vulnerable state and quite poorly with a number of lifelong mental and physical health conditions, and suffering the effects of overprescription of drugs by numerous different Drs and specialists who did not communicate amongst themselves.
I attended an appointment with a GP at Ashfields who took the time to listen to the whole of my story, list of medications and past difficult experiences in healthcare. He worked with me in partnership to prioritise my needs, make appropriate referrals, alterations to medications and used the extensive social prescribing services locally.
It was wonderful to be able to see specialists on site with very short waiting times in comparison to my previous surgery. The Dr also suggested a variety of reading and learning that I could undertake to support my recovery, including psycho education at the Involvement Recovery and Wellness Centre at Cheshire and Wirral Partnership Mental Health Trust. 
18 months on my health has improved significantly, I am no longer taking innumerable medications, have had my diagnoses reviewed and adjusted, have taken part in local get active and weight management programmes and have lost over 4st in weight. I feel much more confident in myself and my ability to manage my health and have started volunteering. This turnaround was unthinkable to me before coming to the practice.
My only criticism would be that the local pharmacy provision is under resourced and the administration of prescriptions can sometimes be inefficient, especially with complex poly-pharmacy across an array of medical specialisms. I think that this is not solely an internal problem, as manufacturing delays have been caused by Brexit and Covid and there are a limited number of pharmacies locally which have their own administrative inefficiencies that add to errors and delays.
Despite this single issue, everyone at the practice from Receptionists, Phlebotomists, Nurses, Drs and Allied Health Professionals have been welcoming and friendly. They have worked together to help me improve my health and wellbeing. They are person centred in approach, treating patients as human beings not medical conditions to be fixed. I would not hesitate to recommend this practice to anyone new to the area. In particular they have been excellent in their approach to mental health.
Thank you Ashfields for giving me the tools to live a full and productive life.

title: badly managed practice
body:
I have been registered in this practice in 2015, since I was with them they have never provided me with the right help or the right information.
The secretaries are incompetent and unhelpful, they show no care. I went to see them for eye chemical injury they give me a list of local opticians and told me to arrange my own appointment with them. There was no appointment available in the next 3 days and I couldn't wait that long but they said they couldn’t do anything and that I needed to wait. I asked if there is any other emergency eye service I can go to and they said there is none, instead of sending me to the emergency eye clinic in Stepping Hill hospital.
The management and the communication are deplorable. For someone like me who has chronic health problems and needs regular follow ups and consistency from the doctors and health staff, this is definitely not the best health service you can have.

They always give me an appointment with a different GP so I have different diagnosis for the same problem because the GP doesn't bother to look at the system to see your previous medical history which makes it inefficient. I spend a year going for the same problem before they refer me to the specialist and even then the referral didn't include all the relevant information.

Some GPs  they don’t care to let you set for the consultation.
They don’t spend more than 2 minutes with you.

One time the GP told me that he needed to end a consultation because she is late. And the list goes on and on……

title: Great Practice
body: I have been with this practice for over 35 years and have always found them very good at what they do. Always get called up for diabetes, rheumatoid arthritis checks, flu jabs and blood tests, without fail. All the GPS are very approachable and the receptionists are very helpful. During these COVID times they seem to have organised the surgery well.

title: Absolutely egregious
body:
I did not even get past the highly qualified reseptionist, rude, dismissive and worse yet when you go to complain.... No one took that telephone call.
Practice manager is a joke and does nothing to her click of female Receptionists. Discussing close this practice

title: Phone System shockingly bad
body: As others have said phones not answered or takes forever to get through then no appointments left so just told try tomorrow and waste more time. Medicine review appointment cancelled at last moment by surgery a month ago nothing since. Receptionist polite and helpful but only if you can get through. If you were a retail shop you would have no customers. Please don't tell me to ring to discuss you need to fix the phone and appointments system.

title: Booking is not great, but staff are friendly…
body:
I find it almost impossible to get an appointment, every time my children or I have needed to see a doctor in the past year I’ve ended up going to Corby Urgent Care Centre (which is EXCELLENT!). 
The booking system of only calling at a certain time of day seems to create an unnecessary bottleneck and if you are a working parent it’s impossible to be available at that time of day.
I’ve called about family planning 4 times and obviously that’s not an emergency and I don’t need or want a same day appointment but I still need to call at the 8am window each day to try to get a slot which is very impractical, still not got an appointment.
The booking system desperately needs looking into, extremely poor.

title: Much Improved
body: Present support staff a big improvement compared to say five years ago. Appointments system finally working better and more responsive to patient needs.

author: Someonesparent
title: Mental health of daughter
body:
I feel that the homecare team have little or no regard for our daughters needs.  
She is hearing voices and hallucinating. She has requested to be hospitalised as she does not feel she is safe at home alone and is adamant she will harm herself and kill herself if she goes home. She is currently in a short stay crisis centre that is not suitable for the mental health care she needs. The homecare team think it is acceptable to send her home where she lives alone with little or no support as we live 80 miles away. They don't seem to listen and appear when we call to tell us what they think we want to hear. They refused to section her or allow her to voluntary hospitalised under section 5 of the mental health act 1983 which she has the option to voluntary section. The home care team seem to think a pill and occasional visit from them is sufficient. I feel this system is letting her down. All she is asking even begged for help. It has taken 6 days for her to receive medication. Prior to this her own GP had prescribed her one dose of tamazipam to help her sleep which the HCT refused to allow her to take.  
Myself and her dad are extremely disgusted with the service they provide. The crisis centre she is in the staff although are nice they seem to have no idea how to support someone with the mental health need our daughter has.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Reassuring, thorough and professional.
body:
Having been admitted to A&E through 111 and paramedic assessment, I was so impressed by the quality of care I received from every member of staff I saw. 

In particular, the doctor who saw me had an excellent bedside manner. She was very thorough and took the time to explain things to me carefully and comprehensively. 

Being admitted to A&E can be a worrying time. It's reassuring to know that if you do need to get help, the staff here will take excellent care of you. Thank you for all you do.

readBy.name: Plymouth University Urgent and Emergency Care Bsc (2020)

title: Excellent service
body: Calls are always answered by a polite and helpful person....no pressing numbers to choose options. GP has been in regular contact with patient and family, making a referral to consultant without delay

title: Very caring
body: My brother has a TBI and has been in Meyrick ward for 6 weeks. All the staff have been fantastic with him under difficult circumstances. The OT especially. Thank you so much it much made life easier for us as a family because we knew he was being well looked after. Once again Thank you.

title: Five star minor injuries clinic
body: Had a wonderful experience here with my daughter yesterday who fractured her wrist at school. We were treated brilliantly by all staff, particular thank you to the nurse practitioner and the plaster technician. The whole hospital feels very covid safe and we were in and out within an hour. Thank you to all involved.

title: Excellent care
body: Every single staff member from reception to Consultant looked after me today with outstanding care . The Colonoscopy I required filled me with absolute dread and anxiety.  But from the moment I arrived I couldn't have been better cared for . Fantastic staff in that unit . THANK YOU.

title: Excellent
body: the dermatology nurses at Beckenham Beacon have been so professional but also very kind and personable

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body: I would like to say a big thank you to the Audiology Repairs Department. Since the first lockdown in March I have had 3 occasions to contact them about repairs to my hearing aids. on each occasion I have found them to be both courteous and extremely efficient, which made the whole experience of a repair much less stressful and easier to manage. My sincere thanks to the team.

author: Weea
title: Being in ward 19
body: I was admitted to ward 19 for the first time in my life. I was shown to my room which I was told to stay there. I was upset but no-one seemed to care, the room was very bland which I wanted to leave as the room was horrible. The toilet was disgusting, the walls very broken and horrible. The nurse then came to see me and was very stubborn, seemed that they didn't really care how I felt. I was made to stay in the room until someone came to see me. If the rooms were more positive then it would help peoples mental health. I felt that I didn't get the support I thought I would have. The food was disgusting there wasn't really a choice especially if you are a fussy eater. Some of the staff were helpful, some of them weren't. While I was in there I was told my b12 was low as well which it was the first I had ever been told. I was told I was to get a loading dose for 2 weeks of 5 injection then every 3 months after that. I was also told I had a infection in my urine but never followed that up by giving me anything. I have been out nearly 2 weeks now and not had a phone call or told what I need to do, which I feel as if I have been left to do things on my own now.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

title: Staff was very not nice
body: I’m new patient , come to register to GP and staff was very rude and unwelcome , start argue with me with no reason, make me feel very bad , as I didn't press ring button strong enough , and ask where I can put “new register forms” as website said “ hang in hands” not “leave outside in the box” . Would say event in covid-19 situation need more respect and understand. Hope they will make some improvements as really not nice welcome for new patients . Kind Regards new unwelcome patient

title: Friendly and helpful staff
body:
Seen GP for my ongoing issues I feel safe to come into the Surgery because they have safety measurements in place. Reception staff is always helpful and friendly when calling for appointments or questions about referrals. 

Thank you all, Patel

title: Outstanding practice, clinicians - just one small…
body:
I'm old enough to have lived in three continents and many orners of the UK and this place is run incredible well.  (Ive had some nightmare experiences of NHS)

Great GPs very tolerant,  phone access and messaging that actually works, and appointments  that are available.

Switchboard and reception staff ALSO flawless - Just one fly in the ointment, one certain practice administrator  (switchboard back office supervisor - not practice manager) that is a complete bureaucratic nightmare on every level, an argumentative type that really should never be public facing. (heard from others too) which is such a pity - as this practice fully deserves the outstanding  rating it has.

99% Outstanding (but every place that 1% individual I guess)

title: Nearly impossible to get an appointment
body: I am asked to make an appointment for a routine review. I call at 10.30 am to be told I can't make an appoint unless I ring at 8am. If you ring at 8 am the lines are constantly unavailable as if the phone has been taken off the hook.

title: Great team work
body:
I would like to thank the paramedic and Dr who gave their time yesterday to diagnose and proscribe the medication to relieve the most chronic pain I was in. The paramedic worked on what the problem was, but asked a fellow Dr for a second opinion which was agreed was the right diagnosis. The result of using the medication I can only describe as a miracle. The team work by paramedic and Dr was outstanding. Sometimes you have sporting heroes but this team is my hero.
Many thanks 
BMcG

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Terrible practice
body: Can never get hold of them and when you finally get through to them they are rude.. One of the worse doctors I've been to!

title: An absolute joke of a surgery
body: The worst surgery ive ever come accross! The receptionists are an abolute joke! They give different informarion each time and when you question them about this they take the easy way out and hang up on you! Knowing it is very unlikely we're going to wait 40 mins in a queue again to speak to someone! This has happened about 10 times now! Ive never come accross such poor service! They dont know how to communicate at all, no politeness or respect, each time i come off the phone i feel either very upset or frustrated. Theyre an absolute nightmare surgery to deal with that give conflicting information each time! This definitly needs to be addressed as its clear the receptionists are lacking knowledge of basic procedures and services the surgery offers and they need to be trained on how to actually speak to people with respect instead of hanging up and being completely rude! Its just always feels like a battle ringing through to the surgery to get anything sorted. This is just the receptionists, im not even going to comment on the GPs and their incompetence and lack of care and urgency!

title: No notice of appointment
body:
I was waiting for 6 months for an appointment.

Then I received a letter saying I had failed to arrive at one without any communication of the appointment.

Very disappointed

title: Impossible to get through
body:
It is almost impossible to get through to make an appointment. If you try early get engaged tone. When finally connected to queueing system took an hour to answer only to be advised no appointments and try again tomorrow at 8:15. I appreciate it’s busy currently but this is not a new challenge. 
If insist will make an emergency appointment though do have to be insistent. 
Reception staff are polite and I appreciate that they can only work with the system they have. Time it was reviewed or perhaps a realistic number of patients registered at the practice no one has the time to spend the whole morning attempting to make an appointment. Doctors are lovely when finally able to speak to them.

title: Knowledge, Patience and Understanding.
body:
I must thank all the A & E Staff  for their kindness yesterday whilst in the A & E department.
Knowledge, Kindness and Understanding was my experience. I must also thank the Dr who attended me ( Cubicle 3 30/11/2020 ) Gave me great advice , very friendly and understanding. A Dr I hope goes a long long way in the NHS--what a nice man.

However thanks to all staff including the CT dept.

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Not always helpful
body: The receptionists are great and do a wonderful job.  However other members of the practice seem to want to deflect responsibility for patients' treatment back to the patient (the clue is in their so-called mission statement).  I don't have the greatest of PC skills, my eyesight is poor and I am deaf to the point where I cannot fully make out what people say on the phone.  Consequently I rely a lot on written communications.  But it seems this practice can't do that, preferring to ask patients to phone or jump through hoops with the online GP 'app'.  I imagine it's easier to get an audience with the Queen herself!  Maybe we should blame the Coronavirus for this lack of attention?

title: Great Clinics
body: I can only say that from Thursday 15 October when I saw my GP who referred me to Health Harmonie, I received a phone call that afternoon to go to a clinic on Sunday 18 October, and my treatment continued from then until Saturday 21 November, everything was excellent, the staff and the treatment I received, appointments on time, free parking, It couldn't have been better. I would recommend these clinics to anybody.
